Key Match Events: Germany were held to a 0-0 draw by Ukraine in a friendly match in Nuremberg on June 3, 2024.
Germany dominated long periods but failed to make the breakthrough against a resilient Ukraine.
Germany's best chance fell to Ilkay Guendogan, who missed a golden first half chance.
Maximilian Beier hit the post with a first-time shot from Robert Andrich's through ball.
Ukraine's goalkeeper Anatolii Trubin made a string of top saves to keep Germany at bay.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany came into the game having won their last two matches against France and the Netherlands.
Julian Nagelsmann was without key players Toni Kroos, Antonio Ruediger, Nico Schlotterbeck, and Niclas Fuellkrug.
Post-Match Reflections: Julian Nagelsmann will be pleased with the performances of Pascal Gross and Robert Andrich.
The result poses some questions for Germany ahead of their final warm-up game against Greece on June 7, 2024.
Miscellaneous Highlights: More than 44,000 fans attended the match at Max-Morlock Stadion in Nuremberg.
Ukraine qualified for their fourth straight Euro with a play-off victory over Iceland in March.
